Example of use of Java Basque Locale

{{{
import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.Locale;

public class BasqueLocaleTest {
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Locale basqueLocale = new Locale("eu","ES");
		Locale germanLocale = new Locale("de","DE");
		
		//Country Names
		System.out.println("Spain in German: " + basqueLocale.getDisplayCountry(germanLocale));
		System.out.println("Germany in Basque: " + germanLocale.getDisplayCountry(basqueLocale));
		System.out.println("Spain in Basque: " + basqueLocale.getDisplayCountry(basqueLocale));
		
		//Language Names
		System.out.println("Basque in German: " + basqueLocale.getDisplayLanguage(germanLocale));
		System.out.println("German in Basque: " + germanLocale.getDisplayLanguage(basqueLocale));
		System.out.println("Basque in Basque: " + basqueLocale.getDisplayLanguage(basqueLocale));
		
		//Date Format
		Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();
		SimpleDateFormat formatter = new SimpleDateFormat("MMMM", basqueLocale);
		System.out.println("Month: "+formatter.format(cal.getTime()));
		System.out.println("Today SHORT: "+DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.SHORT, basqueLocale).format(cal.getTime()));
		System.out.println("Today MEDIUM: "+DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.MEDIUM, basqueLocale).format(cal.getTime()));
		System.out.println("Today LONG: "+DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.LONG, basqueLocale).format(cal.getTime()));
		System.out.println("Today FULL: "+DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.FULL, basqueLocale).format(cal.getTime()));

		System.out.println("NEXT WEEK:");
		for(int n= 0; n < 7; n++)
		{
			cal.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR, 1);
			System.out.println(DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.FULL, basqueLocale).format(cal.getTime()));
		}

		System.out.println("NEXT MONTHS:");
		for(int n= 0; n < 12; n++)
		{
			cal.add(Calendar.MONTH, 1);
			System.out.println(DateFormat.getDateInstance(DateFormat.FULL, basqueLocale).format(cal.getTime()));
		}
	}
}
}}}
